docs.snippet: The Lebanese director Nadine Labaki's feature ''Where Do We Go Now?,'' a top prize-winner at last year's Toronto International Film Festival, will be the opening-night presentation of the 41st New Directors/New Films series, the annual program org...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Lebanese director Nadine Labaki's feature ''Where Do We Go Now?,'' a top prize-winner at last year's Toronto International Film Festival, will be the opening-night presentation of the 41st New Directors/New Films series, the annual program organized by the Film Society of Lincoln Center and the Museum of Modern Art. The lineup also includes Stanley Kubrick's feature-length debut as well as the first 3-D feature to be shown at New Directors/New Films, its organizers said on Thursday. ''Where Do We Go Now?,'' which won the Cadillac People's Choice Award in Toronto, tells a story of Muslim and Christian women in a remote village in Lebanon who band together to prevent its men from starting a religious war. The film, which was Lebanon's submission for the best foreign-language Oscar this year (but did not receive a nomination), will be shown at MoMA on March 21 and is to get a theatrical release from Sony Pictures Classics.
docs.abstract: Film Society of Lincoln Center and the Museum of Modern Art announce the lineup for the 41st New Directors/ New Films series. (M)

headline.main: Lebanese Movie to Open New Directors/New Films
